page.title: 01Landscape of Forteviot.
page.content: Forteviot the once Pictish Capital of Scotland,lies six miles South West of Perth on the B9112 and five miles West of Bridge of Earn along the B935. The Ochil hills are South of our village.The River May lying West of Forteviot flows North from the Ochil hills into the River Earn which in its turn flows East into the River Tay. The land of Strath Earn is very fertile mixed farmland owned mainly by The Laird and his son who own most of the land,letting it out mainly to estate workers. Today's village is not the original one.Between 1925-1926 the old line of cottages was pulled down and the new courtyard of terraced houses, designed by the Laird himself, erected.
